intro: Corydalis ambigua var. glabra, commonly known as the smooth Corydalis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and clusters of small, delicate flowers. The leaves are typically lance-shaped and arranged alternately along the stem. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain several seeds, and it thrives in well-drained, rocky soils. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has been used in traditional medicine in some cultures.
